alert.note: Alert for Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 31 at 5:58AM ADT until March 31 at 6:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE SOUTHERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE SOUTHERN COASTAL PLAINS... The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 5 PM AST this afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 014 and 027, which includes the southeast and southwest coastal plains of Puerto Rico. * WIND...Sustained winds around 20 mph and gusts around 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...Relative humidity values near or below 35 possible. * THUNDERSTORMS...None. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island
